title: Grand National - A Drink And A Quick Decision
description:
<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_National_(band)" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_National_(band)</a>

A Drink and a Quick Decision is the second album from British duo Grand National. The album was released on September 11, 2007 in the US, and September 17, 2007 in the UK. Initial pressings of the album come with the bonus track "Old Man," a Neil Young cover, and an enhanced video of "By the Time I Get Home There Won&#039;t Be Much of a Place for Me."

The album takes on a darker tone than their debut Kicking the National Habit from 2004. Billboard Magazine described the album as "an indie rocker&#039;s idea of Saturday Night Fever," and Stylus Magazine described the song "Joker and Clown" as "one of 2007&#039;s best ballads."

The title of the album is a lyric taken from the hit song "She&#039;s Gone" by Hall and Oates.[1]
